noun.description: The name of a book, composition, or other artistic work.
examples: the author and title of the book

noun.description: A name that describes someone's position or job.
examples: Leese assumed the title of director general

noun.description: The position of being the champion of a major sports competition.
examples: Davis won the world title for the first time in 1981

noun.description: A right or claim to the ownership of property or to a rank or throne.
examples: a local family had title to the property
the buyer acquires a good title to the merchandise

noun.description: (in church use) a fixed sphere of work and source of income as a condition for ordination.

verb.description: Give a name to (a book, composition, or other work)

origin: Old English titul, reinforced by Old French title, both from Latin titulus inscription, title. The word originally denoted a placard or inscription placed on an object, giving information about it, hence a descriptive heading in a book or other composition.
